revised_title: Effects of Faradic Excitation of the Cerebrum on Respiration in Monkeys, Dogs, Cats, and Rabbits
tldr: This study investigates the effects of faradic excitation of the cerebrum on respiration in monkeys, dogs, cats, and rabbits. The research focuses on understanding the representation of respiration in the highest nerve centers and the impact of various regions of the cerebral hemisphere being excited. The findings provide insights into the relationship between brain stimulation and respiratory movements.
